{"type":"json_schema","json_schema":{"id":17787,"attracts":[],"care_guides_details":[{"type":"watering","description":"Sedum × rubrotinctum, also known as the Jelly Bean Plant, is a succulent that requires minimal watering. It's essential to let the soil dry out entirely between waterings. Inactive during winter, it may only need water once every month or two. During active growth in spring and summer, water deeply but infrequently - usually every 2-3 weeks, depending on your climate. Overwatering can lead to root rot, so ensure the pot has good drainage, and never let the plant sit in water. Always water at the soil level to keep the leaves dry, reducing the risk of fungal issues."},{"type":"sunlight","description":"The Jelly Bean Plant thrives in bright, indirect sunlight but can also tolerate full sun. Generally, providing around six hours of direct sunlight per day is ideal. However, in extremely hot climates, it's beneficial to offer some afternoon shade to prevent sunburn on the leaves. A south or east-facing window is perfect if growing indoors. If the plant doesn’t receive enough light, it may become leggy and lose its vibrant colors. During winter, when light levels drop, increase sunlight exposure as much as possible to keep the plant healthy and colorful."},{"type":"pruning","description":"Pruning Sedum × rubrotinctum is only necessary to remove any dead or damaged leaves and stems. This succulent rarely requires regular pruning since it naturally maintains a compact shape. If the plant becomes leggy, usually due to low light, you can trim the stems back to promote bushier growth. Use clean, sharp scissors or pruning shears to prevent infections. Spring is the best time for pruning, as plants are generally in a growth phase. The cuttings from pruning can also be propagated easily by letting them dry for a day and then planting in well-draining soil."}],"care_level":"Easy","common_name":"Christmas-cheer","description":"Sedum rubrotinctum or Sedum × rubrotinctum, and commonly known as jelly-beans, jelly bean plant, or pork and beans. It is a species of Sedum from the plant family Crassulaceae. {"type":"json_schema","json_schema":{"id":16593,"attracts":["Bees","Butterflies"],"care_guides_details":[{"type":"watering","description":"Lonicera fragrantissima, or Winter Honeysuckle, prefers consistently moist soil but can tolerate some short periods of drought once established. It is crucial to provide regular watering during its first growing season to establish an extensive root system. Water thoroughly but allow the soil to dry slightly between waterings. Overwatering can lead to root rot. In general, water deeply once or twice a week during dry spells. Mulching around the base can help retain soil moisture and keep the roots cool. Adjust your watering schedule depending on the local climate conditions and season."},{"type":"sunlight","description":"Lonicera fragrantissima thrives in full sun to partial shade conditions. While the plant can tolerate full shade, it produces more flowers when exposed to adequate sunlight. Ideally, it should receive at least six hours of direct sunlight daily to encourage optimal blooming and lush growth. In hotter climates, it's beneficial to provide the plant with some afternoon shade to prevent leaf scorch. If grown in partial shade, expect fewer blooms. Ensure the site has good air circulation, which can support healthy growth and minimize the risk of fungal diseases. Adjust sunlight exposure according to the plant's performance and environment."},{"type":"pruning","description":"Pruning Lonicera fragrantissima should be done after the flowering period, which usually ends in late spring. This shrub benefits from annual pruning to maintain a desirable shape and encourage new growth. Remove any dead, damaged, or diseased wood using clean, sharp pruning shears. Thin out older, congested stems to improve air circulation and sun penetration. For rejuvenating older shrubs, more severe pruning may be necessary by cutting back some of the oldest stems to the ground to trigger new shoots. Light shaping and thinning can also help keep the plant neat and promote healthy growth."}],"care_level":"Medium","common_name":"Winter honeysuckle","description":"Lonicera fragrantissima is a species of flowering plant in the honeysuckle family known by the common names winter honeysuckle, fragrant honeysuckle, January jasmine, Chinese honeysuckle, kiss-me-at-the-gate, and sweet breath of spring. It is native to China and has been an introduced species to other parts of the world. It was brought to the attention of western gardeners by Scottish plant hunter Robert Fortune, who was plant hunting in China for the Royal Horticultural Society. Fortune introduced","family":null,"flower_color":"White","flowering_season":false,"fruit_color":"[\"Red\"]","growth_rate":"Moderate","harvest_season":null,"leaf_color":["Green"],"maintenance":"Moderate","origin":["China"],"other_name":["Winter honeysuckle"],"pest_susceptibility":["Aphids","Leaf spot diseases"],"propagation":["Cutting","Seed Propagation"],"pruning_month":["August"],"scientific_name":["Lonicera fragrantissima"],"soil":["Well-drained"],"watering_period":"Morning"}}
